<TABLE ID="0507E964EDEE4AF58F5E834F12C490F7" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: WINGDINGS; WIDTH: 15PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	l
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	we face intense competition from real estate developers that are already in the business for years;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="D20D1E8C89B043ECA0891A748A30840E" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: WINGDINGS; WIDTH: 15PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	l
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	our experience and expertise gained from our manufacturing business may not be particularly relevant or applicable to a real estate development and management business; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="A50D5652A2EE4577A00D7158B25D9517" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 21PT">
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: WINGDINGS; WIDTH: 15PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	l
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	we may not be able to generate enough revenues to offset our costs in our real estate development and management business.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	If we are not successful in development of our property development project, our growth, business, financial condition and results of operations could be adversely affected.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	20
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage21"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We may not have adequate financing, whether through bank loans or other arrangements, to fund the redevelopment of our Shenzhen factory site, and capital resources may not be available on commercially reasonable terms, or at all.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Redevelopment of our Shenzhen factory will require us to make a significant investment. Property development is capital intensive, and we do not currently have the necessary capital to fund the redevelopment project. We plan to finance our property redevelopment from our cash on hand, bank facilities and other sources. We cannot assure you that lenders will grant us sufficient financing in the future to fully fund the redevelopment project or that funding will be available from other sources. Further, the financing policies of the PRC government relating to the property development sector have varied. It is possible that the PRC government may further tighten financing policies on PRC financial institutions for the property development sector. These property-related financing policies may limit our ability and flexibility to use bank borrowings to finance our property redevelopment project.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We may fail to obtain, or experience material delays in obtaining, requisite certificates, licenses, permits or governmental approvals for redevelopment of our Shenzhen factory, and as a result our redevelopment plans, business, results of operations and financial condition may be materially and adversely affected.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Property development in the PRC is heavily regulated. Property developers in China must abide by various laws and regulations, including implementation rules promulgated by local governments to enforce these laws and regulations. During various stages of our property redevelopment project, we will be required to obtain and maintain various certificates, licenses, permits, certificates and governmental approvals, including but not limited to qualification certificates, land use rights certificates, construction land planning permits, construction works planning permits, construction works commencement permits, pre-sale permits and completion certificates. Before the government authorities issue any certificate, license or permit, we must also meet specific conditions. We cannot assure you that we will be able to adapt to new PRC land policies that may come into effect from time to time with respect to the property development industry or that we will not encounter other material delays or difficulties in fulfilling the necessary conditions to obtain all necessary certificates, licenses or permits for our property development in a timely manner, or at all, in the future. If we fail to obtain or encounter significant delays in obtaining the necessary certificates, licenses or permits we will not be able to continue with our redevelopment plans, and our business, results of operations and financial condition may be adversely affected.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Certain Legal Consequences of Foreign Incorporation and Operations
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Judgments Against The Company And Management May Be Difficult To Obtain Or Enforce.
</FONT>
	&#160; We are a holding corporation organized as an International Business Company under the laws of the British Virgin Islands (&#8220;BVI&#8221;), and our principal operating subsidiaries are organized under the laws of Hong Kong and the laws of the PRC.&#160; Our principal executive offices are located in Hong Kong and the PRC.&#160; Outside the United States, it may be difficult for investors to enforce judgments obtained against us in actions brought in the United States, including actions predicated upon the civil liability provisions of United States federal securities laws.&#160; In addition, most of our officers and directors reside outside the United States, and the assets of these persons are located outside the United States.&#160; As a result, it may not be possible for investors to effect service of process within the United States upon these persons or to enforce against the Company or these persons judgments predicated upon the liability provisions of United States federal securities laws.&#160; Our Hong Kong counsel and our British Virgin Islands counsel have advised that there is substantial doubt as to the enforceability against us or any of our directors or officers in original actions or in actions for enforcement of judgments of United States courts in claims for liability based on the civil liability provisions of United States federal securities laws.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	21
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage22"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	No treaty exists between Hong Kong or the British Virgin Islands and the United States providing for the reciprocal enforcement of foreign judgments. However, the courts of Hong Kong and the British Virgin Islands are generally prepared to accept a foreign judgment as evidence of a debt due. An action may then be commenced in Hong Kong or the British Virgin Islands for recovery of this debt. A Hong Kong or British Virgin Islands court will only accept a foreign judgment as evidence of a debt due if:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="6E697F46D7904C1089F8CD3C0BD244BD" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	the judgment is for a liquidated amount in a civil matter;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="3995B3E6B96E4D0AA4B1836CC6EFCABA" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	the judgment is final and conclusive;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="9E02E8CE65A643509053CCDD3B43E0CA" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	the judgment is not, directly or indirectly, for the payment of foreign taxes, penalties, fines or charges of a like nature (in this regard, a Hong Kong court is unlikely to accept a judgment for an amount obtained by doubling, trebling or otherwise multiplying a sum assessed as compensation for the loss or damage sustained by the person in whose favor the judgment was given);
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="A258725F4E204DBCBDC090F7C807C1BB" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	the judgment was not obtained by actual or constructive fraud or duress;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="E65303E54BAA414D88CB32E45EC5B209" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	the foreign court has taken jurisdiction on grounds that are recognized by the common law rules as to conflict of laws in Hong Kong or the British Virgin Islands;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="E5E649843BD74E6C8D7F8FFCFF914B7E" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	the proceedings in which the judgment was obtained were not contrary to natural justice (i.e. the concept of fair adjudication);
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="3544F2A0DFE44E30BA66F6C50A6EB2A9" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	the proceedings in which the judgment was obtained, the judgment itself and the enforcement of the judgment are not contrary to the public policy of Hong Kong or the British Virgin Islands;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="11087FDF3AAF45D5BD77454E1C5896E9" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	the person against whom the judgment is given is subject to the jurisdiction of a foreign court; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<TABLE ID="08A1FB8EA4F9492CAB9CB1CD2BB60769" CLASS="DSPFLISTTABLE" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; WIDTH: 100%" CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: SYMBOL, SERIF; WIDTH: 18PT; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; ALIGN: RIGHT">
	&#183;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: AUTO; VERTICAL-ALIGN: TOP; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
	the judgment is not on a claim for contribution in respect of damages awarded by a judgment, which fall under Section&#160;7 of the Protection of Trading Interests Ordinance, Chapter 7 of the Laws of Hong Kong.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Enforcement of a foreign judgment in Hong Kong or the British Virgin Islands may also be limited or affected by applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, liquidation, arrangement and moratorium, or similar laws relating to or affecting creditors&#8217; rights generally, and will be subject to a statutory limitation of time within which proceedings may be brought.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Because We Are Incorporated In The British Virgin Islands, You May Not Have The Same Protections As Shareholders Of U.S. Corporations.
</FONT>
	&#160; We are organized under the laws of the British Virgin Islands.&#160; Principles of law relating to matters affecting the validity of corporate procedures, the fiduciary duties of our management, directors and controlling shareholders and the rights of our shareholders differ from, and may not be as protective of shareholders as, those that would apply if we were incorporated in a jurisdiction within the United States.&#160; Our directors have the power to take certain actions without shareholder approval, including amending our Memorandum or Articles of Association, which are the terms used in the British Virgin Islands for a corporation&#8217;s charter and bylaws, respectively, and approving certain fundamental corporate transactions, including reorganizations, certain mergers or consolidations and the sale or transfer of assets.&#160; In addition, there is doubt that the courts of the British Virgin Islands would enforce liabilities predicated upon United States federal securities laws.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	22
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage23"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Future Issuances Of Preference Shares Could Materially And Adversely Affect The Holders Of Our Common Shares Or Delay Or Prevent A Change Of Control.&#160;
</FONT>
	Our Memorandum and Articles of Association provide the ability to issue an aggregate of 10,000,000 shares of preferred stock in four classes.&#160; While no preferred shares are currently issued or outstanding, we may issue preferred shares in the future.&#160; Future issuance of preferred shares could materially and adversely affect the rights of the holders of our common shares, dilute the common shareholders&#8217; holdings or delay or prevent a change of control.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Our Shareholders Do Not Have The Same Protections Or Information Generally Available To Shareholders Of U.S. Corporations Because The Reporting Requirements For Foreign Private Issuers Are More Limited Than Those Applicable To Public Corporations Organized In The United States.
</FONT>
	&#160; We are a foreign private issuer within the meaning of rules promulgated under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (the &#8220;Exchange Act&#8221;).&#160; We are not subject to certain provisions of the Exchange Act applicable to United States public companies, including:&#160; the rules under the Exchange Act requiring the filing with the SEC of quarterly reports on Form 10-Q or current reports on Form 8-K, the sections of the Exchange Act regulating the solicitation of proxies, consents or authorizations with respect to a security registered under the Exchange Act and the sections of the Exchange Act requiring insiders to file public reports of their stock ownership and trading activities and establishing insider liability for profits realized from any &#8220;short-swing&#8221; trading transaction (i.e., a purchase and sale, or sale and purchase, of the issuer&#8217;s equity securities within six months or less).&#160; Because we are not subject to these rules, our shareholders are not afforded the same protections or information generally available to investors in public companies organized in the United States.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Our Board&#8217;s Ability To Amend Our Charter Without Shareholder Approval Could Have Anti-Takeover Effects That Could Prevent A Change In Control.
</FONT>
	&#160; As permitted by the laws of the British Virgin Islands, our Memorandum and Articles of Association may be amended by our Board of Directors without shareholder approval.&#160; This includes amendments to increase or reduce our authorized capital stock.&#160; Our Board&#8217;s ability to amend our charter documents without shareholder approval could have the effect of delaying, deterring or preventing a change in control of Bonso, including a tender offer to purchase our common shares at a premium over the current market price.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	We Have Not Paid Dividends Since 2007 And May Not Pay Dividends In The Future.
</FONT>
	&#160; We have not paid dividends on our common stock since 2007, and we may not be able to declare dividends, or the Board of Directors may decide not to declare dividends, in the future.&#160; We will determine the amounts of any dividends when and if they are declared, in the future at the time of declaration.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	23
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage24"></A>
</DIV>
</EFX_KEY_INFORMATION>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<EFX_COMPANY_INFORMATION>
<A NAME="FIS_COMPANY_INFORMATION"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Item 4.&#160; Information on the Company
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	History and Development of the Company
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Bonso Electronics International Inc. was formed on August 8, 1988 as a limited liability International Business Company under the laws of the British Virgin Islands under the name &#8220;Golden Virtue Limited.&#8221;&#160; On September 14, 1988, we changed our name to Bonso Electronics International Inc.&#160; We operate under the BVI Business Companies Act.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Effective as of May 1, 2001 we acquired 100% of the equity of Korona Haushaltswaren GmbH &amp; Co. KG, a limited liability partnership registered in Germany (&#8220;Korona&#8221;).&#160; Korona marketed consumer scale products throughout Europe to retail merchandisers and distributors.&#160; Effective March 31, 2009, we sold certain assets of Korona to Beurer GmbH, including inventories, accounts receivable, toolings and intellectual property rights.&#160; Korona completed its liquidation in February 2012.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	In April 2007, we formed a wholly-owned subsidiary, Bonso USA, Inc., a Nevada corporation ("Bonso USA"), to focus on the sales of industrial scales in the U.S. market. Bonso USA has been dormant since 2009 and no business activities are being conducted by this subsidiary.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	For a description of our current operating subsidiaries, see &#8220;Organizational Structure,&#8221; below.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; MARGIN-RIGHT: 1.2PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Our corporate administrative matters are conducted through our registered agent, HWR Services Limited, P.O. Box 71, Road Town, Tortola, British Virgin Islands.&#160; Our principal executive offices are located at Unit 1404, 14/F, Cheuk Nang Centre, 9 Hillwood Road, Tsimshatsui, Kowloon, Hong Kong.&#160; Our telephone number is (852) 2605-5822, our facsimile number is (852) 2691-1724, our e-mail address is info@bonso.com and our website is www.bonso.com.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Business Overview
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Bonso Electronics International Inc. designs, develops, produces and sells electronic sensor-based and wireless products for private label original equipment manufacturers (individually &#8220;OEM&#8221; or, collectively, &#8220;OEMs&#8221;), original brand manufacturers (individually &#8220;OBM&#8221; or, collectively, &#8220;OBMs&#8221;) and original design manufacturers (individually, &#8220;ODM&#8221; or, collectively, &#8220;ODMs&#8221;).
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Since 1989, we have manufactured all of our products in China in order to take advantage of the lower overhead costs and competitive labor rates.&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	From 1989 until 2013, all of our production took place in our Shenzhen factory; however, during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2013 we began production in our Xinxing factory.&#160; We moved all production processes from our Shenzhen factory to the Xinxing factory during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014, and we rented out the old Shenzhen factory to a third party as a source of rental income.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	24
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage25"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Our primary business has been the design, development, production and sale of electronic sensor-based and wireless products. Effective with the transfer of manufacturing operations to our new factory in Xinxing we leased our factory in Shenzhen to a third party. This lease marks our entry into the &#8220;property&#8221; business. The lease with the third party terminates in August 2019. We have engaged consultants to assist us in obtaining the necessary governmental approvals to permit us to redevelop the Shenzhen factory into a high end commercial complex, containing retail space, office space and some residential space. We anticipate completing the approval process in 2018; however, there can be no assurance that we will be successful in obtaining all necessary approvals.&#160; If we are successful in obtaining the necessary governmental approvals for the redevelopment, we believe that the rental income derived from leasing the redeveloped property will be a significant contributing factor to our profit in the future.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Our principal capital expenditures on property, plant and equipment over the last three years are set forth below:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Our capital expenditures include construction-in-progress, leasehold improvement and the purchase of machinery used in the production of certain of our products.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	All of the foregoing capital expenditures were financed principally from internally generated funds, except for three motor vehicles purchased with capital leases.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Products
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Our sensor-based scale products include bathroom, kitchen, office, jewelry, laboratory, postal and industrial scales that are used in consumer, commercial and industrial applications.&#160; These products accounted for 95% of revenue for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014, 89% for 2015 and 93% for 2016.&#160; We believe that our sensor-based scale products will continue to be a major portion of our scales revenue as we are able to secure orders from our major customers.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	&#160;During the fiscal year ended March 31, 2013, the Company began to produce certain electrical pet care products, including a bark control device.&#160; These products accounted for 6% of revenue for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, 10% for 2015 and 4% for 2014.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We also receive revenue from certain customers for the development and manufacture of tooling and molding for scales and pet electronics products although most of the tools and moulds which we produce are used by us for the manufacture of our products.&#160; We also generate some sales of scrap materials.&#160; These revenues accounted for approximately 1% of net sales for each of the last three fiscal years.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>

</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Business Strategy
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We believe that our future growth depends upon our ability to eliminate or decrease the manufacture and sale of lower margin products, strengthen our customer base by enhancing and diversifying our products, increasing the number of customers and expanding into additional markets while maintaining or increasing sales of our products to existing customers, and focusing upon the production and sale of higher margin products. Our future growth and our ability to become profitable are also dependent upon our ability to control production costs and increase production capacity.&#160; Our strategy to achieve these goals is as follows:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Increased Focus Upon Manufacturing and Selling Higher Margin Products and the Elimination or Decrease in the Production and Sale of Lower Margin Products.&#160;
</FONT>
	In seeking to return to profitability, we analyzed our product mix and concluded that we were most likely to return to profitability if we eliminated the production and sale of lower margin products that require the employment of larger numbers of workers and the commitment of substantial resources to carry or stock raw materials and components inventory. We advised our largest customer for these low margin electronic scale products that without substantial price increases, we would not be in position to continue manufacturing these products in the calendar year beginning January 1, 2015. That customer did not agree to the price increases that we requested, and has shifted this business to alternative suppliers.&#160; With the decrease in the production and sale of lower margin products, the Company increased its gross profit from 20.2% for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015, to 31.0% for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Product Enhancement And Diversification.
</FONT>
	&#160; We continually seek to improve and enhance our existing products in order to provide a longer product life-cycle and to meet increasing customer demands for additional features.&#160; Our research and development staff are currently working on a variety of projects to enhance our existing scale products and in the postal scale/meter area.&#160; Further, we are developing certain electrical pet care products.&#160; See &#8220;Product Research and Development&#8221; and &#8220;Competition,&#8221; below.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Maintaining And Expanding Business Relations With Existing Customers.
</FONT>
	&#160; We promote relationships with our significant customers through regular communication, including visiting certain of our customers in their home countries and providing direct access to our manufacturing and quality control personnel.&#160; This access, together with our concern for quality, has resulted in a relatively low level of defective products.&#160; Moreover, we believe that our emphasis on timely delivery, good service and low cost has contributed, and will continue to contribute, to good relations with our customers and increased orders.&#160; Further, we solicit suggestions from our customers for product enhancement and when feasible, attempt to develop and incorporate the enhancements suggested by our customers into our products.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	26
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage27"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Controlling Production Costs
</FONT>
	.&#160; In 1989, recognizing that labor cost was a major factor permitting effective competition in the consumer electronic products industry, we relocated all of our manufacturing operations to China to take advantage of the large available pool of lower-cost manufacturing labor.&#160; Continuing this approach and recognizing that labor costs are significantly lower in Xinxing than in Shenzhen, we moved all of our manufacturing from Shenzhen to Xinxing, and there was a reduction in our labor costs as a result. In addition, we have continued to shift production and manufacturing of various parts and components to third party suppliers, including plastic injection molded parts and metal parts. In some cases, we have entered into agreements with third parties in which they lease our equipment from us, and then manufacture parts and components that we use in assembling our final products. Those third parties provide the workers and supervisors, and the necessary raw materials. We lease our machinery or equipment, our dormitory facilities for their workers and supervisory staff and our meals or cafeteria services for the third party&#8217;s workers and staff. There are other third party contractors that utilize their own equipment and their own facilities in manufacturing specific components or parts for us.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We are actively seeking to control production costs by such means as redesigning our existing products in order to decrease material and labor costs, controlling the number of our employees, increasing the efficiency of workers by providing regular training and tools and redesigning the flow of our production lines.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	New Manufacturing Facility
</FONT>
	.&#160; In November 2006, Bonso entered into a land purchase agreement to acquire 133,500 square meters of land use right for future expansion in Xinxing, China.&#160; In July 2015, the Company entered into an agreement to sell approximately 23,500 square meters of that land use right, leaving the Company with approximately 110,000 square meters. The office building on the Xinxing site was completed in February 2015, and its leasehold renovations were completed in January 2016. All manufacturing operations have been moved from Shenzhen to Xinxing.&#160; We intend to carefully monitor our capacity needs and to expand capacity as necessary in the future.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Customers and Marketing
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We sell our products primarily in the United States and Europe.&#160; Customers for our products are primarily OEMs, OBMs and ODMs which market the products under their own brand names.&#160; We market our products to OEMs, OBMs and ODMs through our sales staff at trade shows and via e-mail, our website and facsimile.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Net export sales to customers by geographic area constituting 10% or more of total sales of the Company consisted of the following for each of the three years ended March 31, 2014, 2015 and 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	27
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="VERTICAL-ALIGN: MIDDLE; PADDING-BOTTOM: 2PX; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">

	We maintain a marketing and sales team of seven people.&#160; Also, our experienced engineering teams work directly with our customers to develop and tailor our products to meet the customers&#8217; specific needs.&#160; We market our products primarily through a combination of direct contact by our experienced in-house technical sales staff and through trade shows and via e-mail, our website and facsimile.&#160; No commission payments were paid to the sales team during the fiscal years ended March 31, 2014, 2015 and 2016.

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Component Parts and Suppliers
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We purchase over 1,000 different component parts from more than 100 major suppliers and are not dependent upon any single supplier for key components.&#160; We purchase components for our products primarily from suppliers in Japan, Taiwan, Hong Kong and China.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The price of oil and other raw materials increased during the fiscal years ended March 31, 2011 and 2012 resulting in an increase of our component part prices.&#160; We have taken steps to reduce our exposure to any inability to obtain components by forecasting with an increased buffer rate and placing orders for components earlier to allow for longer delivery lead times.&#160; Because of these actions, we do not expect to experience any difficulty in obtaining needed component parts for our products.&#160; The price level of raw materials remained stable in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014, compared to that in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2013, and decreased slightly in each of the fiscal years ended March 31, 2015 and March 31, 2016 compared to each of the immediately previous fiscal years.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	28
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage29"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Quality Control
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We have received ISO 9001:2008 certification from BSI Assurance UK Limited.&#160; The ISO 9001:2008 certification was awarded to our subsidiary, Bonso Advanced Technology (Xinxing) Company Limited.&#160; ISO 9001 is one of the ISO 9000 series of quality system standards developed by the International Organization for Standardization, a worldwide federation of national standards bodies.&#160; ISO 9001 provides a model for quality assurance (and continuous improvement) in product development, manufacturing, installation and servicing that focuses on meeting customer requirements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The European Union has enacted the Restriction of the Use of Certain Hazardous Substances in Electrical and Electronic Equipment Directive (&#8220;RoHS&#8221;).&#160; RoHS prohibits the use of certain substances, including lead, in certain products.&#160; We believe that we are in compliance with RoHS and have a supply of compliant components from suppliers.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The Company provides to certain customers an additional one to two percent of certain products ordered in lieu of a warranty, which are recognized as cost of sales when these products are shipped to customers from our facility.&#160; In addition, certain products sold by the Company are subject to a limited product quality warranty.&#160; The Company accrues for estimated incurred but unidentified quality issues based upon historical activity and known quality issues if a loss is probable and can be reasonably estimated.&#160; The standard limited warranty period is one to three years.&#160; Quality returns, refunds, rebates and discounts are recorded net of sales if they are within the warranty period.&#160; All sales are based upon firm orders with fixed terms and conditions, which generally cannot be modified.&#160; Historically, we have not experienced material differences between our estimated amounts of quality returns, refunds, rebates and discounts and the actual results.&#160; Our contracts do not contain price protection or similar privileges in relation to the sale of goods.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Patents, Licenses, Trademarks, Franchises, Concessions and Royalty Agreements
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We have obtained a trademark registration in Hong Kong and China for the marks BONSO and MODUS in connection with certain electronic apparatus.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We rely on a combination of patent, trademark and trade secret laws, employee and third party non-disclosure agreements and other intellectual property protection methods to protect our proprietary rights.&#160; There can be no assurance that third parties will not assert infringement or other claims against us with respect to any existing or future products.&#160; We cannot assure you that licenses would be available if any of our technology were successfully challenged by a third party, or if it became desirable to use any third-party technology to enhance the Company&#8217;s products.&#160; Litigation to protect our proprietary information or to determine the validity of any third-party claims could result in a significant expense to us and divert the efforts of our technical and management personnel, whether or not such litigation is determined in our favor.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	While we have no knowledge that we are infringing upon the proprietary rights of any third party, there can be no assurance that such claims will not be asserted in the future with respect to existing or future products.&#160; Any such assertion by a third party could require us to pay royalties, to participate in costly litigation and defend licensees in any such suit pursuant to indemnification agreements or to refrain from selling an alleged infringing product or service.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>

<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	29

<A NAME="eolPage30"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Product Research and Development
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The major responsibility of the product design, research and development personnel is to develop and produce designs to the satisfaction of, and in accordance with, the specifications provided by the OEMs, OBMs and ODMs.&#160; We believe our engineering and product development capabilities are important to the future success of our business.&#160; As an ODM, we take specifications that are provided to us by the customer and design a product to meet those specifications.&#160; Some of our product design, research and development activities are customer funded and are under agreements with specific customers for specific products.&#160; To reduce costs, we conduct our research and development at our facilities in China.&#160; We principally employ Chinese engineers and technicians at costs that are substantially lower than those that would be required in Hong Kong.&#160; At March 31, 2016, we employed 11 individuals in Hong Kong and China for our engineering staff, who are at various times engaged in research and development.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Competition
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The manufacture and sale of electronic sensor-based and wireless products is highly competitive.&#160; Competition is primarily based upon unit price, product quality, reliability, product features and management&#8217;s reputation for integrity. Accordingly, reliance is placed on research and development of new products, line extensions and technological, quality and other continuous product improvement.&#160; There can be no assurance that we will enjoy the same degree of success in these efforts in the future.&#160; Research and development expenses aggregated approximately $366,000, $228,000 and $200,000 during the fiscal years ended March 31, 2014, 2015 and 2016, respectively.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Seasonality
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Generally, the first calendar quarter of each year is typically the slowest sales period because our manufacturing facilities in China are closed for two weeks for the Chinese New Year holidays to permit employees to travel to their homes in China.&#160; In addition, sales during the first calendar quarter of scales products usually dip following the increase in sales during the Christmas season.&#160; A greater number of our sales of scales products occur between the months of July and October for shipment in preparation for the Christmas holiday.&#160; Throughout the remainder of the year, our products do not appear to be subject to significant seasonal variation.&#160; However, past sales patterns may not be indicative of future performance.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Transportation
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Typically, we sell products either F.O.B. Hong Kong, Yantian (Shenzhen) or Nansha (Guangzhou), which means that our customers are responsible for the transportation of finished products from Hong Kong, Yantian (Shenzhen) or Nansha (Guangzhou) to their final destination.&#160; Transportation of components and finished products to and from the point of shipment is by truck.&#160; To date, we have not been materially affected by any transportation problems.&#160; However, transportation difficulties affecting air cargo or shipping, such as an extended closure of ports that materially disrupts the flow of our customers&#8217; products to their destination, mainly the United States and Europe, could materially and adversely affect our sales and margins if, as a result, our customers delay or cancel orders or seek concessions to offset expediting charges they incurred pending resolution of the problems causing the port closures.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	30
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage31"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Government Regulation
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We are subject to comprehensive and changing foreign, federal, provincial, state and local environmental requirements, including those governing discharges into the air and water, the handling and disposal of solid and hazardous waste and the remediation of contamination associated with releases of hazardous substances.&#160; We believe that we are in compliance with current environmental requirements.&#160; Nevertheless, we use hazardous substances in our operations and, as is the case with manufacturers in general, if a release of hazardous substances occurs on or from our properties we may be held liable and may be required to pay the cost of remediation.&#160; The amount of any resulting liability could be material.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Foreign Operations
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Our products are manufactured at our factories located in China.&#160; While China has been granted permanent most favored nation trade status in the United States through its entry into the World Trade Organization, controversies between the United States and China may arise that threaten the status quo involving trade between the United States and China.&#160; These controversies could materially and adversely affect our business by, among other things, causing our products in the United States to become more expensive, resulting in a reduction in the demand for our products by customers in the United States.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Sovereignty over Hong Kong reverted to China on July 1, 1997.&#160; The 1984 Sino-British Joint Declaration, the 1990 Basic Law of Hong Kong, the 1992 United States-Hong Kong Policy Act and other agreements provide some indication of the business climate we believe will continue to exist in Hong Kong.&#160; Hong Kong remains a Special Administrative Region (&#8220;SAR&#8221;) of China, with certain autonomies from the Chinese government.&#160; Hong Kong is a full member of the World Trade Organization.&#160; It has separate customs territory from China, with separate tariff rates and export control procedures.&#160; It has a separate intellectual property registration system.&#160; The Hong Kong Dollar is legal tender in the SAR, freely convertible and not subject to foreign currency exchange controls by China.&#160; The SAR government has sole responsibility for tax policies, though the Chinese government must approve the SAR&#8217;s budgets.&#160; Notwithstanding the provisions of these international agreements, we cannot be assured of the continued stability of political, legal, economic or other conditions in Hong Kong.&#160; No treaty exists between Hong Kong and the United States providing for the reciprocal enforcement of foreign judgments.&#160; Accordingly, Hong Kong courts might not enforce judgments predicated on the federal securities laws of the United States, whether arising from actions brought in the United States or, if permitted, in Hong Kong.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	31
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage32"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Organizational Structure
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<IMG STYLE="HEIGHT: 281PX; WIDTH: 705PX" BORDER="0" SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/08/15/0001079973-16-001119_IMAGE0.JPG">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We have two wholly-owned Hong Kong subsidiaries, Bonso Electronics Limited (&#8220;BEL&#8221;) and Bonso Advanced Technology Limited (&#8220;BATL&#8221;).&#160; Both BEL and BATL were organized under the laws of Hong Kong and are responsible for the design, development, manufacture and sale of our products.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	BEL has one active Hong Kong subsidiary, Bonso Investment Limited (&#8220;BIL&#8221;).&#160; BIL was organized under the laws of Hong Kong and has been used to acquire and hold our investment properties in Hong Kong and China.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	BEL also has one active PRC subsidiary, Bonso Electronics (Shenzhen) Company, Limited (&#8220;BESCL&#8221;), which is organized under the laws of the PRC and was used to manufacture our products until January 2014.&#160;&#160; BESCL leased its factory to a third party from August 2013 to August 2019, and is receiving a monthly rental income of approximately $109,000 as of August 2016.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	Effective with the transfer of manufacturing operations to Xinxing, we ceased manufacturing in this subsidiary and its principal business today is leasing our former manufacturing facility to a third party.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	BATL has two active PRC subsidiaries, Bonso Advanced Technology (Xinxing) Company, Limited (&#8220;BATXXCL&#8221;), which is organized under the laws of the PRC and is used to acquire and hold our new manufacturing facility in Xinxing, Guangdong, China, and Bonso Technology (Shenzhen) Company Limited (&#8220;BTL&#8221;), in Shenzhen, PRC, to provide product design and distribution services for the Group.&#160; BATL has a PRC subsidiary, Xinxing An Bang Metal and Plastic Manufacturing Company Limited (&#8220;ANB&#8221;), in Xinxing, Guangdong, PRC, which has ceased its operations since May 2015 and is under de-registration.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We also have a wholly-owned British Virgin Islands subsidiary, Modus Enterprise International Inc. (&#8220;Modus&#8221;), which owned 100% of Korona until Korona&#8217;s liquidation during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2012 and which owns 100% of Bonso USA, which has been dormant since 2009 and does not conduct any business activities.&#160; (See &#8220;History and Development of the Company,&#8221; above.)
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>

	Property, Plant and Equipment
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	British Virgin Islands
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Our corporate administrative offices are located at Cragmuir Chambers, Road Town, Tortola, British Virgin Islands and corporate administrative matters are conducted through our registered agent, HWR Services Limited, located at P.O. Box 71, Road Town, Tortola, British Virgin Islands.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Hong Kong
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We own a residential property in Hong Kong, which is located at Savanna Garden, House No. 27, Tai Po, New Territories, Hong Kong.&#160; House No. 27 consists of approximately 2,475 square feet plus a 177 square foot terrace and a 2,308 square foot garden area.&#160; The use of House No. 27 is provided as quarters to Mr. Anthony So, the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of the Company.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	China
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Our Shenzhen factory in China is located at Shenzhen in the DaYang Synthetical Development District, close to the border between Hong Kong and China.&#160; This factory consists of one
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	factory building, which contains approximately 186,000 square feet, two workers&#8217; dormitories, containing approximately 103,000 square feet, a canteen and recreation center of approximately 26,000 square feet, an office building, consisting of approximately 26,000 square feet, and two staff quarters for supervisory employees, consisting of approximately 34,000 square feet, for a total of approximately 375,000 square feet.&#160; The Company entered into a rental agreement in June 2013 to rent out the Shenzhen factory to a third party from August 2013 to August 2019.&#160; We received a monthly rental income of approximately $99,000 until August 2016, when it increased to approximately $109,000 until August 2019.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We have engaged consultants to assist us in obtaining the necessary governmental approvals to permit us to redevelop the Shenzhen factory into a high end commercial complex, containing retail space, office space and some residential space.&#160; We anticipate completing the approval process in 2018; however, there can be no assurance that we will be successful in obtaining all necessary approvals. If we are successful in obtaining the necessary governmental approvals for the redevelopment, we believe that the rental income derived from leasing the redeveloped property will be a significant contributing factor to our profit in the future.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	In addition, we own two office units in Beijing, namely Units 12 and 13 on the third floor, Block A of Sunshine Plaza in Beijing, China.&#160; Unit 12 consists of 1,102 square feet and Unit 13 consists of 1,860 square feet.&#160; One unit is rented to an unaffiliated third party for an aggregate monthly rental of approximately RMB 12,000, or approximately $2,000, while the other unit is rented to another unaffiliated third party for an aggregate monthly rental of approximately RMB 8,000 or approximately $1,000.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Our Xinxing factory is located in Xinxing High-Tech Industrial Estate, Xinxing, Yunfu City, Guangdong, China.&#160; This factory land area is 1,185,000 square feet, with one factory building consisting of 225,000 square feet, one warehouse consisting of 62,000 square feet, three dormitories consisting of an aggregate of 85,000 square feet and an office building consisting of 49,000 square feet.&#160; Leasehold improvements being made to the office building were completed in January 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;

	&#160;
