</DIV>
<EFX_OPERATING_AND_FINANCIAL_REVIEW>
<A NAME="FIS_OPERATING_AND_FINANCIAL_REVIEW"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Item 5.&#160; Operating and Financial Review and Prospects
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The following discussion and analysis should be read in conjunction with Item 3. &#8211; &#8220;Key Information &#8211; Selected Financial Data&#8221; and the Consolidated Financial Statements and Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements included elsewhere in this Annual Report.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Overview
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	During the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, the Company experienced decreased revenues.&#160; Our overall sales decreased due to our discontinuation of manufacturing and sales of certain lower margin products.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We derive our revenues principally from the sale of sensor-based scales manufactured in China, which represent 93% of total sales for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016.&#160; As mentioned in Item 3. &#8211; &#8220;Key Information &#8211; Risk Factors,&#8221; we are dependent upon a limited number of major customers for a significant portion of our revenues.&#160; Our revenues and business operation are subject to fluctuation if there is a loss of orders from any of our largest customers.&#160; Further, the pricing of our scale products is becoming increasingly competitive, especially to our customers in the United States and Germany, who contributed approximately 78% of our revenue during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	34
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage35"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Net sales, income from operations and net (loss) / income were approximately $31,305,000, $295,000 and ($221,000), respectively, for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014, $28,944,000, $462,000 and $1,110,000, respectively, for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015 and $23,892,000, $3,302,000 and $2,871,000, respectively, for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Labor costs per worker are increasing in China.&#160; In accordance with the new minimum wage set by the local authorities, we increased the minimum wage for our labor in Shenzhen, PRC from RMB 1,320 (or approximately $206) per month beginning April 1, 2011, to RMB 1,500 (or approximately $238) per month beginning February 1, 2012, RMB 1,600 (or approximately $254) per month beginning March 1, 2013, and then to RMB 1,808 (or approximately $293) per month beginning February 1, 2014 in Shenzhen, PRC.&#160; The minimum wage was RMB 1,010 (or approximately $164) per month in Xinxing, Guangdong, PRC beginning May 1, 2013 and is currently RMB 1,210 (or approximately $181).&#160; We believe that future increases in labor costs in China would have a significant effect on our total production costs and results of operations.&#160; Our labor costs represented approximately 12.6% of our total production costs in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, compared to 11.8% in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015 and 14.5% in 2014. Total labor costs decreased from approximately $2,715,000 in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015 to approximately $2,073,000 in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016. The decrease in overall labor costs was the result of a lower production level required due to reduced revenue. There can be no assurance that labor costs will not increase in the future or that any additional increase in labor costs will not have a material adverse effect upon our results of operations.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We have continued to shift production and manufacturing of various parts and components to third party suppliers, including plastic injection molded parts and metal parts. In some cases, we have entered into agreements with third parties in which they lease our equipment from us, and then manufacture parts and components that we use in assembling our final products. Those third parties provide the workers and supervisors, and the necessary raw materials. We lease our machinery or equipment, our dormitory facilities for their workers and supervisory staff, and our meals or cafeteria services for the third party&#8217;s workers and staff. There are other third party contractors that utilize their own equipment and their own facilities in manufacturing specific components or parts for us.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We have not experienced significant difficulties in obtaining raw materials for our products, and management does not anticipate any such difficulties in the foreseeable future.&#160; Prices of raw materials increased during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2011, but did not vary significantly during the fiscal years ended March 31, 2012, 2013 and 2014.&#160; The price of some of the raw materials utilized by the Company fluctuates directly with the price of oil, and the price of raw materials decreased slightly in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015, compared to that in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014 and decreased in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 compared to 2015. There can be no assurance that raw material costs will not fluctuate or that any additional increase in raw material costs will not have a material adverse effect upon our results of operations.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	In seeking to return to profitability, in 2014 we analyzed our product mix and concluded that we were most likely to return to profitability if we eliminated the production and sale of lower margin products that require the employment of larger numbers of workers and the commitment of substantial resources to carry or stock raw materials and components inventory. We advised our largest customer for these low margin electronic scale products that without substantial price increases we would not be in a position to continue manufacturing these products in the calendar year beginning January 1, 2015. That customer did not agree to the price increases that we requested, and has shifted this business to alternative suppliers. With the decrease in the production and sale of lower margin products, the Company increased its gross profit from 20.2% for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015, to 31.0% for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	35
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage36"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 compared to fiscal year ended March 31, 2015
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Net Sales
</FONT>
	.&#160; Our sales decreased approximately $5,052,000, or 17.5%, from approximately $28,944,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015 to approximately $23,892,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016.&#160; The decrease in sales was primarily due to lower customer demand for our existing products, together with the elimination of products with lower profit margins.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Gross Profit
</FONT>
	.&#160; Gross profit as a percentage of revenue increased to approximately 31.0% during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, as compared to approximately 20.2% during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015.&#160; The higher gross margin was primarily the result of the abandoning of products with lower profit margins.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	36
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage37"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Rental Income.&#160;
</FONT>
	Rental income increased by approximately $24,000, or 1.7% from approximately $1,453,000 for the fiscal years ended March 31, 2015 to approximately $1,477,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 as a result of increased production area being rented out at our Xinxing facility.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Selling Expenses
</FONT>
	.&#160; Selling expenses decreased by approximately $402,000, or 48.9%, from approximately $822,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015 to approximately $420,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016.&#160; The decrease was the result of reduced net sales and a reduction in required air shipments.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Salaries And Related Costs
</FONT>
	.&#160; Salaries and related costs decreased by approximately $205,000, or 6.5%, from approximately $3,166,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015 to approximately $2,961,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016.&#160; The decrease in salaries and related costs was primarily the result of a reduction in the number of employees due to lower net sales.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Research And Development Expenses
</FONT>
	.&#160; Research and development expenses decreased approximately $28,000, or 12.3%, from approximately $228,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015 to approximately $200,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016.&#160; The decrease in research and development was primarily the result of a decrease in the number of engineers employed.&#160; Research and development expenses account for 0.8% of net revenue for both the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, and the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Administration And General Expenses.
</FONT>
	&#160; Administration and general expenses increased by approximately $258,000, or 8.0%, from approximately $3,245,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015 to approximately $3,503,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016.&#160; The increase was primarily the result of a one-time compensation expense of approximately $801,000 due to stock options granted during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Other Income.&#160;
</FONT>
	Other income decreased approximately $264,000 or 50.8%, from approximately $520,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015 to approximately $256,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016.&#160; The decrease was primarily the result of decreased gain from revaluation of forward contracts.&#160; During the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, the Company recorded a gain from revaluation of forward contract of approximately $36,000, while the Company recorded a gain on valuation of forward contracts of approximately $131,000 during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015.&#160; In addition, the Company recorded approximately $194,000 for the reduction of aged accounts payable for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015, as compared to $nil during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Gain on Disposal of Property, Plant and Equipment
</FONT>
	.&#160;&#160; Gain on disposal of property, plant and equipment increased approximately $620,000, or 632.7%, from $98,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015 to approximately $718,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016.&#160; The gain on disposal of approximately $718,000 was the result of the sale of a residential property in Shenzhen to a third party.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;

<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	37
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage38"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Gain on Disposal of Intangible Assets
</FONT>
	.&#160;&#160;
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	Gain on disposal of intangible assets was approximately $519,000 during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, as compared to $nil during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015
</FONT>
	.&#160; The increase was primarily the result of gain on disposal of a land use right of part of the land at our Xinxing facility.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Income From Operations
</FONT>
	.&#160; As a result of the factors described above, income from operations increased by 614.7% from a profit of approximately $462,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015 to a profit of approximately $3,302,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Interest Income
</FONT>
	.&#160; Interest income decreased to approximately $15,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, as compared to approximately $18,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015, due to lower interest rates on deposit accounts. During the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015, the Company earned 0.25% per annum, or approximately $3,000, from a fixed deposit in RMB for which the interest rate was pegged to the appreciation rate of RMB against USD. During the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, the Company did not enter into similar fixed deposit arrangement.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Interest Expense
</FONT>
	. Interest expense decreased approximately $160,000, or 58.6%, from approximately $273,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015 to approximately $113,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016.&#160; The decrease was primarily the result of less utilization of banking facilities since the Company&#8217;s operating activities generated positive net cash flows during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 .
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Foreign Exchange Loss.
</FONT>
	Foreign exchange loss decreased approximately $111,000, or 82.8%, from approximately $134,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015 to approximately $23,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016.&#160; This decrease was primarily the result of reduced foreign exchange activities with the increased usage of Chinese Renminbi for both payments received and expenses paid.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 35.45PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Income Tax Credit / (Expense)
</FONT>
	.&#160; Income tax expense was approximately $310,000 during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, as compared to an income tax credit of $1,037,000 during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015. The increase in income tax expense was the result of an increase in income before tax generated during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 as compared to the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Net Income
</FONT>
	.&#160; As a result of the factors described above, net income increased from approximately $1,110,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015 to approximately $2,871,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, an increase in income of approximately $1,761,000, or 158.6%.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Foreign Currency Translation Adjustments.
</FONT>
	Foreign currency translation adjustments, net of tax, decreased from a gain of approximately $123,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015 to a loss of approximately $850,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, a decrease of approximately $973,000, or 791.1%.&#160; The decreased foreign currency translation adjustment, net of tax, was primarily the result of depreciation of assets denominated in Chinese Renminbi after translation to US Dollars.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Comprehensive Income.
</FONT>
	As a result of the factors described above, comprehensive income increased from approximately $1,233,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015 to approximately $2,021,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, an increase of approximately $788,000 or 63.9%.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;

</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage39"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Fiscal year ended March 31, 2015 compared to fiscal year ended March 31, 2014
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Net Sales
</FONT>
	.&#160; Our sales decreased approximately $2,361,000, or 7.5%, from approximately $31,305,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014 to approximately $28,944,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015.&#160; The decrease in sales was primarily due to our strategic decision to give up orders of certain lower margin electronic scale products.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Gross Profit
</FONT>
	.&#160; Gross profit as a percentage of revenue increased to approximately 20.2% during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015, as compared to approximately 8.5% during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014.&#160; The higher gross margin was primarily the result of a higher percentage of sales being of higher margin products.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Rental Income.&#160;
</FONT>
	Rental income increased approximately $745,000 or 105.2%, from approximately $708,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014 to approximately $1,453,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015.&#160; The increase was primarily the result of a full year of rental income generated from the Shenzhen factory during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015, as compared to partial rental income generated since August 1, 2013 from the Shenzhen factory during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Selling Expenses
</FONT>
	.&#160; Selling expenses increased by approximately $433,000, or 111.3%, from approximately $389,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014 to approximately $822,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015.&#160; The increase was the result of air freight costs incurred due to a delay in production of certain orders of lower margin electronic scale products.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Salaries And Related Costs
</FONT>
	.&#160; Salaries and related costs increased by approximately $183,000, or 6.1%, from approximately $2,983,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014 to approximately $3,166,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015.&#160; The increase in salaries and related costs was primarily the result of an increase in employee insurance and pension expenses for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Research And Development
</FONT>
	.&#160; Research and development expenses decreased approximately $138,000, or 37.7%, from approximately $366,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014 to approximately $228,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015.&#160; The decrease in research and development was primarily the result of a reduction in engineers for lower margin electronic scale products.&#160; Research and development expenses account for 0.8% of net revenue for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015, and for 1.2% of net revenue for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	39
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage40"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Administration And General Expenses.
</FONT>
	&#160; Administration and general expenses increased by approximately $281,000, or 9.5%, from approximately $2,964,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014 to approximately $3,245,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015.&#160; The increase was primarily attributable to an increase in depreciation and local tax payments for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Other Income.&#160;
</FONT>
	Other income increased approximately $500,000 or 2,500.0%, from approximately $20,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014 to approximately $520,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015.&#160; The increase was primarily the result of an increase of $132,000 gain on valuation of forward contracts and an increase of $194,000 for the reduction of aged accounts payable for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Gain on Disposal of Property, Plant and Equipment
</FONT>
	.&#160;&#160; Gain on disposal of property, plant and equipment decreased approximately $3,497,000, or 97.3%, from $3,595,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014 to approximately $98,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015.&#160; The gain of $3,595,000 for the disposal of property, plant and equipment for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014 was related to the Shenzhen factory, and was recorded when we transferred all production processes to the Xinxing factory and leased out the Shenzhen factory for rental income.&#160; However, no such large gain on disposal of property, plant and equipment was realized during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Income From Operations
</FONT>
	.&#160; As a result of the factors described above, income from operations increased by 56.6% from a profit of approximately $295,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014 to a profit of approximately $462,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Interest Income
</FONT>
	.&#160; Interest income decreased to approximately $18,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015, as compared to approximately $64,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014, due to lower interest rates on saving accounts and fixed deposit accounts.&#160; During the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014, the Company earned 6% per annum, or approximately $62,000, from a fixed deposit in RMB with the interest rate pegged to the appreciation rate of RMB against USD.&#160; During the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015, the Company earned 0.25% per annum, or approximately $3,000, from a similar fixed deposit in RMB for which the interest rate was pegged to the appreciation rate of RMB against USD.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Interest Expense
</FONT>
	. Interest expense increased approximately $137,000, or 100.7%, from approximately $136,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014 to approximately $273,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015.&#160; This increase was primarily the result of an increase in bank borrowings obtained in the PRC with higher interest rates.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Foreign Exchange Loss.
</FONT>
	Foreign exchange loss decreased approximately $310,000, or 69.8%, from approximately $444,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014 to approximately $134,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015.&#160; This decrease was primarily the result of decrease in magnitude of the appreciation of Chinese Yuan against the United States Dollars during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 35.45PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Income Tax Credit / (Expense)
</FONT>
	.&#160; Income tax credit was approximately $1,037,000 during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015, as compared to $nil during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014. The increase in income tax credit was the result of the reversal of over-provision of the prior years&#8217; uncertain income tax liability. The tax review was concluded and confirmed with local tax authorities during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	40
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage41"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Net (Loss) / Income
</FONT>
	.&#160; As a result of the factors described above, net income increased from a loss of approximately $221,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014 to income of approximately $1,110,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015, an increase in income of approximately $1,331,000, or 602.3%.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Foreign Currency Translation Adjustments.
</FONT>
	Foreign currency translation adjustments, net of tax, decreased from approximately $257,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014 to approximately $123,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015, a decrease of approximately $134,000, or 52.1%.&#160; The decreased foreign currency translation adjustment, net of tax, was primarily the result of reduced fluctuation of the Chinese Renminbi against the United States Dollar.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC">
	Comprehensive (Loss) / Income.
</FONT>
	As a result of the factors described above, comprehensive gain increased from an income of approximately $36,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014 to an income of approximately $1,233,000 for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015, an increase of approximately $1,197,000 or 3,325%.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Impact of Inflation
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We believe that inflation had an impact on our business during the fiscal years ended March 31, 2012, 2013 and 2014.&#160; The minimum wage in Shenzhen, PRC, increased from RMB 1,100 (or approximately $162) per month beginning July 1, 2010 to RMB 1,320 (or approximately $206) per month beginning April 1, 2011, and was later increased to RMB 1,500 (or approximately $238) per month beginning February 1, 2012, RMB 1,600 (or approximately $254) per month beginning March 1, 2013 and then to RMB 1,808 (or approximately $293) per month beginning February 1, 2014. We believe that the impact of inflation on our business was minimal during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016 due to the lower price of oil.&#160; However, the minimum wage in Xinxing, PRC was increased from RMB 1,010 per month (or approximately $160) to RMB 1,210 per month (or approximately $181) as of May 1, 2015.&#160; Although the minimum wage in Xinxing did not increase between May 31, 2015 and May 31, 2016, we believe that inflation will continue to increase our operating costs and cost of raw materials and have a significant impact upon us in the future.&#160; We have generally been able to modify and improve our product designs so that we could either increase the prices of our products or lower the production costs in order to keep pace with inflation.&#160; Oil prices have been volatile in recent years.&#160; If oil prices increase, it will likely result in an increase in the cost of components to us, as well as an increase in our operating expenses, which will have a material adverse effect upon our business and results of operations.&#160; Further, the increase in labor costs and operating costs in the PRC has had a material impact on our profitability.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Taxation
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 35.45PT">
	The companies comprising the Group are subject to tax on an entity basis on income arising in, or derived from, Hong Kong and the PRC.&#160; The current rate of taxation of the subsidiary operating in Hong Kong is 16.5%.&#160; The Group is not subject to income taxes in the British Virgin Islands.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	41
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage42"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The tax rate for our subsidiary in the PRC was 25% in 2012 and beyond. There is no tax payable in Hong Kong on offshore profit or on dividends paid to Bonso Electronics Limited by its subsidiaries or to us by Bonso Electronics Limited.&#160; Therefore, our overall effective tax rate may be lower than that of most United States corporations; however, this advantage could be materially and adversely affected by changes in the tax laws of the British Virgin Islands, Hong Kong or China.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Efforts by the Chinese government to increase tax revenues could result in decisions or interpretations of the tax laws by the Chinese tax authorities that are unfavorable to us and which increase our future tax liabilities or deny our expected refunds.&#160; Changes in Chinese tax laws or their interpretation or application may subject us to additional Chinese taxation in the future.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	No reciprocal tax treaty regarding withholding taxes exists between the United States and the British Virgin Islands.&#160; Under current British Virgin Islands law, dividends, interest or royalties paid by us to individuals are not subject to tax as long as the recipient is not a resident of the British Virgin Islands.&#160; If we were to pay a dividend, we would not be liable to withhold any tax, but shareholders would receive gross dividends, irrespective of their residential or national status.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	During the fiscal years ended March 31, 2012, 2013 and 2014, certain of our subsidiaries were, and continue to be, subject to inquiries from the local tax authorities.&#160; Upon the adoption of ASC 740 &#8220;Income Taxes&#8221;, the Company recorded a provision of approximately $2,595,000 in relation to uncertain tax positions as of April 1, 2007.&#160; During the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015, the tax review case was closed and confirmed with the local tax authorities and the final tax and interest payable were approximately $1,545,000.&#160; After offsetting with the tax reserve certificates purchased for approximately $1,710,000, the Company obtained a refund of approximately $165,000.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Contractual arrangements we have entered into among us and our subsidiaries in different locations may be subject to scrutiny by respective tax authorities, and a finding against the Company and its subsidiaries may result in additional tax liabilities that could substantially reduce our consolidated net income.&#160; We could face material and adverse tax consequences if respective tax authorities determine that the contractual arrangements among our subsidiaries and Bonso do not represent an arm&#8217;s length price and adjust Bonso&#8217;s or its subsidiaries&#8217; income.&#160; Our consolidated net income may be materially and adversely affected if our affiliated entities&#8217; tax liabilities increase.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Dividends, if any, paid to any United States resident or citizen shareholder are treated as dividend income for United States federal income tax purposes.&#160; Such dividends are not eligible for the 70% dividends-received deduction allowed to United States corporations on dividends from a domestic corporation under Section 243 of the United States Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the &#8220;Internal Revenue Code&#8221;).&#160; Various Internal Revenue Code provisions impose special taxes in certain circumstances on non-United States corporations and their shareholders.&#160; You are urged to consult your tax advisor with regard to such possibilities and your own tax situation.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	In addition to United States federal income taxation, shareholders may be subject to state and local taxes upon their receipt of dividends.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	42
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage43"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Foreign Currency Exchange Rates
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We sell most of our products to international customers.&#160; Our principal export markets are North America (mainly the United States), Europe (mainly Germany) and Asia.&#160; Other markets are other European countries (such as the United Kingdom), Australia and Africa.&#160; Sales to international customers are made directly by us to our customers.&#160; We sell all of our products in United States Dollars and Chinese Renminbi and pay for our material components principally in United States Dollars, Hong Kong Dollars and Chinese Renminbi.&#160; Most factory expenses incurred are paid in Chinese Renminbi.&#160; Because the Hong Kong Dollar is pegged to the United States Dollar, in the past our only material foreign exchange risk arose from potential fluctuations in the Chinese Renminbi and a devaluation in United States Dollars.&#160; For the reasons discussed in the paragraphs below, management believes that it may be possible that there will be some fluctuation in the coming year. During the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, we experienced a foreign currency exchange loss of approximately $23,000.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN-LEFT: 6PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 30PT">
	A summary of our debts from our banking facilities utilized as at March 31, 2015 and 2016 which were subject to foreign currency risk is as follows:
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN-LEFT: 3.6PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: -3.6PT">
	Hong Kong dollars and Chinese Yuan
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">

</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 13%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	5,206
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 13%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	1,743
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	&#160;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The amount above is due within one year.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Fluctuations in the value of the Hong Kong Dollar have not been significant since October 17, 1983, when the Hong Kong government tied the value of the Hong Kong Dollar to that of the United States Dollar.&#160; However, there can be no assurance that the value of the Hong Kong Dollar will continue to be tied to that of the United States Dollar.&#160; China adopted a floating currency system on January 1, 1994, unifying the market and official rates of foreign exchange.&#160; China approved current account convertibility of the Chinese Renminbi on July 1, 1996, followed by formal acceptance of the International Monetary Fund&#8217;s Articles of Agreement on December 1, 1996.&#160; These regulations eliminated the requirement for prior government approval to buy foreign exchange for ordinary trade transactions, though approval is still required to repatriate equity or debt, including interest thereon.&#160; From 1994 until July 2005, the Chinese Renminbi had remained stable against the United States Dollar at approximately 8.28 to 1.00 United States Dollar.&#160; On July 21, 2005, the Chinese currency regime was altered to link the RMB to a &#8220;basket of currencies,&#8221; which includes
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	the United States Dollar, Euro, Japanese Yen and Korean Won.&#160;
</FONT>
	Under the rules, the RMB was allowed to move 0.3% on a daily basis against the United States Dollar.
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	&#160; The People's Bank of China, on May 21 2007, widened the RMB trading band from 0.3% daily movement against the United States Dollar to 0.5
</FONT>
	%.&#160; On June 20, 2010, the People's Bank of China increased the flexibility of the exchange rate and between June 30, 2010 and December 31, 2013, the value of the Renminbi appreciated approximately 12.0% against the United States Dollar, although the value of the Renminbi depreciated approximately 2.5% against the United States Dollar in 2014. In August 2015, the People's Bank of China changed the way it calculates the mid-point price of Renminbi against the United States Dollar, requiring the market-makers who submit for reference rates to consider the previous day's closing spot rate, foreign-exchange demand and supply as well as changes in major currency rates. As a result, in 2015, the value of the Renminbi depreciated approximately 5.8% against the United States Dollar, and from December 31, 2015 through May 20, 2016, the value of the Renminbi further depreciated approximately 1.1% against the United States Dollar. There remains significant international pressure on the PRC government to adopt a more flexible currency policy, which could result in greater fluctuations of the Renminbi against the United States Dollar. Accordingly, it is difficult to predict how market forces or PRC or U.S. government policy may impact the exchange rate between the Renminbi and the United States Dollar in the future.&#160; As of July 15, 2016, the RMB was valued at 6.6852 per United States Dollar as compared to 6.1089 per United States Dollar as of July 15, 2015.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	43
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage44"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	To manage our exposure to foreign currency and translation risks, we may purchase currency exchange forward contracts, currency options or other derivative instruments, provided such instruments may be obtained at suitable prices.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>
<A NAME="FIS_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL"></A>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	Liquidity and Capital Resources
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We have financed our growth and cash needs to date primarily from internally generated funds and bank debt.&#160; We do not use off-balance sheet financing arrangements, such as securitization of receivables or obtaining access to assets through special purpose entities, as sources of liquidity.&#160; Our primary uses of cash have been to fund expansions and upgrades of our manufacturing facilities.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Operating activities generated approximately $3,855,000 of net cash for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2016, as compared to approximately $2,647,000 of net cash for the fiscal year ended March 31, 2015.&#160; This increase in the amount of cash generated by operating activities was primarily attributable to increased net income and reduction in inventory.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	As of March 31, 2016, we had approximately $3,547,000 in cash and cash equivalents and fixed deposits maturing over three months, as compared to approximately $3,027,000 in cash and cash equivalents and fixed deposits maturing over three months as of March 31, 2015.&#160; Working capital at March 31, 2016 was approximately negative $530,000, as compared to approximately negative $4,391,000 at March 31, 2015.&#160; The increase in working capital was the result of increased net income.&#160; We believe there are no material restrictions (including foreign exchange controls) on the ability of our subsidiaries to transfer funds to us in the form of cash dividends, loans, advances or product/material purchases.&#160; We believe our working capital is sufficient for our present requirements.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	As of March 31, 2016, we had approximately $913,000 in net trade receivables, as compared to approximately $1,306,000 as of March 31, 2015.&#160; This decrease of $393,000 was primarily attributable to reduced net sales.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGENUMBERAREA" STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN'; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	44
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAK" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<HR STYLE="BORDER-LEFT-WIDTH: 0PX; HEIGHT: 2PX; BORDER-RIGHT-WIDTH: 0PX; WIDTH: 100%; BORDER-BOTTOM-WIDTH: 0PX; COLOR: #404040; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN: 4PX 0PX; BORDER-TOP-WIDTH: 0PX; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #404040" NOSHADE="NOSHADE">
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage45"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	As of March 31, 2016, we had approximately $1,823,000 in inventories, as compared to approximately $3,121,000 as of March 31, 2015.&#160; This decrease of $1,298,000 was primarily attributable to the reduction in stock levels required for the manufacturing of our products
</FONT>
	.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000">
	As of March 31, 2016, we had a total of approximately $3,738,000 in notes and accounts payable, as compared to approximately $6,621,000 as of March 31, 2015.&#160; The decrease of $2,883,000 was primarily attributable to lower net sales and efforts to provide earlier repayments to banks and suppliers
</FONT>
	.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	As of March 31, 2016, we had in place general banking facilities with one financial institution with amounts available aggregating approximately $6,189,000 (2015: $9,438,000 from two financial institutions).&#160; Such facilities include the ability to obtain overdrafts, letters of credit, short-term notes payable, factoring, short-term loans, long-term loans and financial instruments including forward contracts.&#160; As of March 31, 2016, we had utilized approximately $1,743,000 from these general banking facilities.&#160; Interest on this indebtedness fluctuates with the prime rate and the Hong Kong Interbank Offer Rate as set by the Hong Kong Bankers Association, and the People&#8217;s Bank of China&#8217;s loan benchmark interest rate.&#160; The bank credit facilities are collateralized by our bank guarantee and an investment property of the Company.&#160; Our bank credit facilities are due for renewal annually.&#160; We anticipate that the banking facilities will be renewed on substantially the same terms and our utilization in the next year will remain at a similar level as that in the current year.&#160; During the fiscal years ended March 31, 2015 and 2016, we paid a total of approximately $273,000 and $113,000, respectively, in interest on indebtedness.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	Our current ratio increased from 0.67 as of March 31, 2015 to 0.93 as of March 31, 2016.&#160; Our quick ratio increased from 0.44 as of March 31, 2015 to 0.71 as of March 31, 2016.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	The minimum wage was increased to RMB 1,320 (or approximately $206) beginning April 1, 2011, and was later increased to RMB 1,500 (or approximately $238) per month beginning February 1, 2012, RMB 1,600 (or approximately $254) per month beginning March 1, 2013, and then to RMB 1,808 (or approximately $293) per month beginning February 1, 2014 in Shenzhen, PRC.&#160; The minimum wage was RMB 1,010 (or approximately $164) per month beginning May 1, 2013 in Xinxing, Guangdong, PRC, and was later increased to RMB 1,210 (or approximately $181) beginning May 1, 2015. Our entire manufacturing operation was moved to Xinxing during the fiscal year ended March 31, 2014, and the overall labor costs have been reduced with the operation in Xinxing.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We expect to spend approximately $48,000 on additional leasehold improvements and new machinery in our Xinxing manufacturing facility.
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="DSPFPAGEBREAKAREA" STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 10PT; CLEAR: BOTH; MARGIN-TOP: 10PT">

<BR STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; COLOR: #000000; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; LINE-HEIGHT: 1; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	We believe that our cash flows from operations, our current cash balance and funds available under our working capital and credit facilities will be sufficient to meet our working capital needs and planned capital expenditures for at least the next 12 to 24 months. However, a decrease in the demand for our products or increase in our costs of goods sold or expenses may affect our internally generated funds, and we would further look to our banking facilities to meet our working capital demands.
</DIV>

	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&#160;
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 11%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ; TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<DIV STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: 'TIMES NEW ROMAN', TIMES, SERIF; LINE-HEIGHT: 1">
	340
</DIV>

<TD STYLE="WIDTH: 1%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; BORDER-BOTTOM-COLOR: ; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM" NOWRAP="NOWRAP">
	&#160;

	&#160;

	&#160;
